PrEP and the Insurance companies. 

If YOU are HIV-negative WITHOUT PrEP, WHY would the insurance companies PAY for your lifetime medical bills when you get infected with HIV?

 The insurance companies are NOT going to like this. 

 You are HIV-negative WITHOUT PrEP (a NON HIV medical condition), but the "experts" are telling you to take PrEP. So you take PrEP and sing the "Happy" song because you THINK life is good. Then you get infected with HIV, a LIFETIME MEDICAL CONDITION.

 After you decide who you are going to sue (lawsuit), your next problem is to figure out WHO is going to pay your LIFETIME HIV related medical expenses. WHY should the insurance companies pay your HIV medical bill?

 NO ONE forced you to take PrEP, you were HIV-negative before taking PrEP.

"Carrie Hall knows what it takes to provide the solutions people need," said CEO Ted Mathas. "She quickly assesses situations and brings in the resources to get the job done. That's what makes her such a valuable advisor to both her clients and her fellow agents." Carrie is a 28-year Agent affiliated with New York Life’s Arizona General Office.

Patrick Klozik of the Austin General Office serves as a member of the AAC’s Technology Integration Committee this year.  An Agent since 2002, Patrick is the owner of Klozik Financial Services, Inc.  He works with business owners and ranchers in developing estate plans that focus on family objectives through minimizing taxes and equitable wealth transfers.

Jim Cohen of the Vermont General Office is a member of the AAC’s Agency Support Committee.  After 15 years in corporate finance as a senior financial analyst, controller and chief financial officer, Jim joined New York Life in 2002.

Just 3 of the major lies I was told by the Dayton Ohio New York Life Insurance Company partner/talent recruiter: 1. I was applying for a salaried management position when in fact there were just "commission only" sales jobs. 2. If I met objectives, I could convert to a salaried starting management position in six months. The minimum time required is actually about 3 years. 3. The salary for a starting manager is $75,000 annually, plus bonuses and incentives that should bring pay up to $110,000. The actually starting salary for a manager is approximately $20,000 and it decreases annually over 3 years as bonuses and incentives are "expected to increase" as team size and performance improves. Yeah. I think those qualify as whoppers. Within days of reporting the lies to the Cincinnati HQ professional development trainer, I was told I must turn in my letter of resignation.
Who’s your role model? http://bit.ly/UZ0UxK #KeepGoodGoing

I just had the world's shortest career working for the New York Life Insurance Company, Dayton office. The senior sales force recruiter/manager there was making false claims (read as MAJOR LIES) to potential sales force recruits. I reported the ethics violations to higher HQ in Cincinnati last week. I was asked to submit my letter of resignation yesterday morning; the action apparently approved in Cincinnati. I guess it's easier to get rid of me than to fix their problem. I never even got a chance to complete my training or conduct an appointment. From what I've seen, New York Life is a good company, but the management in Dayton and Cincinnati leaves much to be desired. The really weird thing is, that same Dayton manager kept an open Bible on his desk, and would intermingle scriptures in his conversation while he would lie to your face, making promises he could never deliver. Ironically, the Bible was open to 1st Corinthians, where the Apostle Paul takes the Christians in Corinth to task for failures in their Christian walk and testimony.

AARP Sent a solicitation for an Insurance quote by NYLIC, better known as New York Life. In as much as NYLIC has chosen to support C.A.I.R. as a sponsor of their NY Gala Meeting, as a long standing member of AARP, I submit my refusal and notice of disapproval. ALL who oppose the group that has been called out by our government as a supporter of Muslim Terrorism, should do likewise and MORE. WE support USA/ISRAEL Partnership against World Terror.

It’s our birthday and we can say with certainty: You’re only as old as you feel. Can you guess some of the famous faces we've insured over the years?

A) Theodore Roosevelt
B) Harry Houdini
C) Susan B. Anthony
D) J.C.Penney
E) All of the above

If you answered E, you’re correct! For nearly two centuries, U.S. Presidents (11 total), magicians, retail store founders & more have entrusted us with their needs. http://bit.ly/1jwDecB

Children’s safety is so important to the Zimmer and our friends at New York Life Insurance Company. THIS SUNDAY New York Life will create Child ID cards for families free of charge! :D

The New York Life staff will assist you with the process which takes just 3 - 5 minutes. New York Life’s Child I.D. program is designed to help children in our community learn how to stay safe in the home, at play or wherever they happen to be.

For more info on New York life, please visit:
http://www.newyorklife.com/

We recently had four siblings kidnapped by their parents. During the investigation there was a delay in getting the proper descriptors along with a current photograph of each child. I am glad to report the kids were found safe & taken into protective custody.  LAPD Officers were in the process of seeking donations to make child ID cards for the community when we had the honor of meeting one of your representatives Ralph Wesson who advised us about your Child ID program.  This Saturday LAPD Hollenbeck Officers along with New York Life Representatives will be in Ramona Gardens providing children & their parents with this beneficial service.  Thank you
